intro: Lasionema grandiflorum, commonly known as the large-flowered lasionema, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the family Polypodiaceae, which includes various ferns and their allies. The plant features delicate, arching fronds with a feathery appearance, and it produces small, clustered spore-bearing structures called sori. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
